message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CR, cs.DS

This paper proposes a method to calibrate machine learning metrics, which is a common problem in the field of machine learning. The paper focuses on evaluating the behavior of calibrated metrics on balanced and imbalanced data, which suggests that it belongs to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses specific real-world use-cases such as model monitoring in production, reporting, or fairness evaluation, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-categories of artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), and cryptography and security (cs.CR). Finally, the paper conducts experiments to assess the behavior of calibrated metrics, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
